lines.text: When a straight man puts on a dress and gets his sexual kicks, he is a transvestite. When a man is a woman trapped in a man's body and has a little operation he is a Transsexual.
I know that.
When a gay man has way too much fashion sense for one gender he is a drag queen.
Thank you.
And when a tired little Latin boy puts on a dress, he is simply a boy in a dress!
Carol Ann, if we're going to be friends, there really is something I should tell you...
Adam's Apple?
What?
Adam's Apple. Women don't have Adam's Apples, only men have Adam's Apples. The first night that you came to town I noticed that you had yourself an Adam's Apple.
Then, then you know?
I know, that I am very fortunate to have a lady friend who just happens to have an Adam's Apple.
When the founding fathers wrote the Declaration of Independence and the Constitution, what have you. "Liberty and justice for all", they didn't mean that.
I can tell you one thing about them founding fathers of America.
What's that?
They sure had fabulous wigs.
Your approval is not needed.
Approval neither desired nor required.
I'm the Latina Marilyn Monroe. I've got more legs than a bucket of chicken!
Now she's gonna get herself kidnapped by some mountain man and we will have to rescue her.
[possibly dead Sheriff Dullard is looking for the owner of a frilly shoe]
Can I have my shoe please?

[disbelieving]
You're a drag queen?
Nothin' this pretty could be real.
Ladies, please, I implore you. For your own safety, go with the Toyota Corolla.
Well, pumpkins, looks like it's the age-old dilemma. Style... or substance.
I love you Ms. Vida Boheme!

[hugs Carol Ann]
I've waited my whole life to hear those words said to that name. And I'm very, very, very happy that you're the one to say them.
Virgil is beating up Carol Ann.
Sounds like...
Well, we have to help her.
No. There are times when you help people, and there are times when *if* you help people you might get killed, so you *don't* help people.
Oh, Carol Ann, what on earth...?
I'm just so clumsy. I mean... Virgil yelled at me. I mean, he called out to me. And, well, I just spilled the stew.
Hun, do you like, ever, not cry in this room?
That might be all fine and dandy but still have a lot more to learn before you become a full fledged Queen, my dear.
Can't I just stay a princess they're so much younger than Queens
[laughs]
Does everything have to be a joke with you, this is not a masquerade! This is real life! There are steps to becoming a Queen.
I'm sorry. How many?
Four! There are four steps to becoming a Drag Queen.
Don't be stingy tell me what are they!
Patience mon cheri. You will know when you've done them. Noxeema our Dutchess of Protocol will inform you.

[laughs sarcastically]
That's right just sit back. Auntie Vida's gonna make you a big ol'queen don't you worry.
Are you serious about Bobby Ray, Miss Chi-Chi?

Baby, you can have him. I've got a million dream lovers, alright. I've got a broken heart for every light on Broadway. And when one of them goes out, I just screw in another one, okay, hello good-bye.

I didn't ask to come on this trip, did I? No, I don't think so! Did I ask you to be making me over and jump all kinds of hoops like some circus poodle? No, I don't think so! Do I want to go to jail because of some cop killer? No, I don't think so! So as soon as we get to the next town I am jumping on the first man and riding him all the way to New York City and away from you two puckered up, stuck up putas 'cause this trip sucks! It sucks!
After all we've done to include you, you would leave us so quickly?
Little latin boy in drag, why are you crying?
It's just cause the two of you are so pretty, you know. You're so pretty.
Yes, of course we're pretty, but why are you crying?
Maybe she just found out Menudo broke up.
How do I look?
Like the Miami Sound Machine just exploded all over you!

[as Vida beats up Virgil]
There's something you need to know about Vida... She...

[quickly]
Vida works out. Yeah, Vida works out.
A lot!

[about Chi-Chi]
Look at her, runnin' like she's runnin' cross the border!

[after Chi-Chi gets upset about being called a Boy in a dress]
You have the potential of a lifetime and you are squandering it.
So what do you care?

Yes you will start off a mere boy in a dress, but by the time we are done with this crusade your Auntie Vida and your Auntie Noxee will give you the outrageous outlook and indomitable spirit that it will take to make you a full-fledged Drag Queen.
So now, I want you to turn your swayback little self around on those Robert Clergerie Knockoffs and get back in this car.
Maybe I'm not just a boy in a dress.
All right you are... a Drag Princess.

[to Vida]
Go on Vida and talk to him, you speak honky!

[to Noxeema & Chi-Chi]
Here is where they asked young Miss Vida to stop imitating Esther Williams in Million Dollar Mermaid, thus marring the Methodist annual picnic.
I think maybe he's prejudice-said.
I'll bet you were the brightest in your class, weren't you?
Oh, my God, I'm like a compass near north.
Thank you.
I'm a princess. "P" to the "R" to the "N" to the "cess". I'm a princess. Latin mystery, dark and sister-y. Princess Chi-Chi.
You know, Vida, you were absolutely right.
About what?

I mean, now I realize that... you gotta take chances. Because you never know, you know what I mean? I mean, what the hell! I'm not gonna worry about if people accept me or not. I'm gonna make Hollywood wherever I am at.
I would like...
Stand up, Vida.
Since you have obviously learned nothing, I am hereby stripping you of all your princess points.
[exaggerated ripping up and throwing away motions]
Oooooh! That's voodoo.

[to Clara]
Ms. Vida seems to think that I don't have a dream. Well, honey, I'm not Martin Luther King. I don't need a dream. I have a plan. You know I'm gonna tell you what it is, because instinctively I knew I could trust you, being as you're not a big talker and everything. My plan is that while in Hollywood I will be approached by an imminent producer, at The Ivy no doubt, to star in the lush film version of the Life of Ms. Dorothy Dandridge. Yes that noble blacktress, who never played domestic help. And then who's career was crushed by the white Hollywood machine.
What in gay hell?
So, I gather you like hitting ladies.
Some ladies need to get hit.
Well then, it stands to reason that some men need to get hit back.
[slaps him]
¡Ay, nenita! Look! Look at this! Look what I found!
Golly, golly, golly.
The seats are like butter.
Now this is a car.
A car? Mary Alice Louise, no. This is a land yacht.
You know, I used to know a lawyer guy who had a car just like this, and I said right then and there I was gonna have one for myself. Vida, can we have this?
But we daren't.

[sitting in a bar, talking to himself]
Men, acting like women. Men wanting to be with one another, men touching each other. Their stubbly chins rubbing up against one another. Touching each other. Manly hands touching swirls of of chest hair. An occasional wiff of a rugged aftershave. Their low, baritone voices sighing, grunting. They hold one another in manly, masculine arms. Hold one another. Tight.
Hello, Loretta.
Hello.
[keeps walking past]

[to Noxeema]
Alcoholic. Low self-esteem. Why, her daddy used to call her "baby ugly." She took to the bottle just as soon as she could drink.
I know what you want. Do you know what you career girls want?
Careers?
Same things every girl wants.
Chi-Chi, you just sit right here. I am going upstairs to have a talk with Miss Noxeema. We will be right back.
I am not going upstairs with you. I ain't drivin' you no more, Miss Daisy!
Internal combustion, the ultimate accessory.

[to Noxeema]
It's like living in a Tex Avery cartoon.
[after Billy Ray comes to ask a girl out]
I declare.
I declare.
*I* declare.
I decline.
This America does not respond kindly to our sort of person.

[sees a picture of Julie Newmar in the reflection of her compact mirror]
Oh! No one say anything frivolous for the next few moments. I am having a significant experience.

[waves her finger in a twirling motion]
Whoopy!

Look, Miss Julie Newmar has been watching silently over this entire conversation. And look at her, vintage Miss Julie. She is the perfect, the ultimate... oh! Try to describe her and not use the word "statuesque". Oh, Miss Julie, you are statuesque and you were the only Catwoman. Oh, read it please.
"To Wong Foo, Thanks for everything, Julie Newmar." Who was Wong Foo?
I don't know but evidently they were close.
I've had enough of this conversation, I'm hungry.
We must take this message from Miss Newmar with us across the land as our sovereign token.
Let's just relax. It's gonna be alright.
I wish I was back in the club car, now we're driving across America.
This is the presidential suite.
Must've been one of those bad presidents.
Baby, you are a whole lot of woman... and I know what you need.
I hardly think you're the man to give it to me.

[after seeing a man wrapped in chains]
I don't know who he is, but if there's a snowstorm tonight, he's going on my tires.
Get with the program mijas, no one is so rich as to throw away a friend.
Why do I feel like I'm in the Tournament of Roses Parade?
Because you're as big as a float.
Your mother.
Thank you.
This is my Aunt Martha's dress. I thought you could use it. She was real big on the shoulders.
Thank you, girl.
Oh, sweet pea. Now, you listen to your Auntie Vida. I want you to believe in yourself, imagine good things and moisturize, I cannot stress this enough.
Miss Noxeema.
Miss Clara.
Now, listen, when you get to Hollywood, you give this letter to Mr. Robert Mitchum.
Oh, I will, I will, I promise you. I'll guard it with my life. Thank you. I'm gonna miss you.
I'm gonna miss you, too.
Good bye.
Bye.
I hope she leaves me those albums in her will. Alright, let's see. Can I hear it?
Good afternoon.
Sounds wonderful. And look at the shirt, the shirt is fierce, and the hair is working. Get along now. You take care. Be good to yourself.

[from trailer]
Look, I'm sorry about the way the civil war turned out.
You obviously have me mistaken for Miss Rosa Parks.

[to Sheriff Dollard]
When a lady says no, she means... get your hand off my dick, buddy!
All right, Ladies. Operation Decorator Storm!
I feel like Miss Jayne Mansfield in this car.
Oooh, Jayne Mansfield. Not a good auto reference.
Vida I do not think of you as a man and I do not think of you as a woman
[pause]
I think of you as an angel.
I think that's Healthy!

[to the other cops]
Shut up! Just shut up! I'm gonna bring back three corpses here! And when you look up their dresses, if you don't find something you shouldn't find, I don't know what!
You know what Vida, you're not a queen because you rule people or you sat on a throne, baby. You're a queen because you couldn't cut it as a man so you had to put on a dress, that's why.

[gets up]
What did you say?

[putting on lotion]
You heard me.

[walks toward Chi-Chi]
I've had quite enough...
[wig catches on hanging decorations and falls off]

[looking around at all the rich houses]
Ohhh, there will be a barbeque at 12 Oaks tonight.
Larger than life is just the right size.
Maps are for cheating.
Don't do that! Don't do that! What are you doing?
Vida, how come you never told us you were rich, mama?
I'm not rich, my parents are.
I think tomorrow is a "Say Something" hat day.

[to Noxeema]
You know, pumpkins?
What?
Sometimes it just takes a fairy.
I'm a loser, I hate myself, I hate my life, I hate everything!
Oh no! No You're a winner, why you look like! You are a winner!
[first lines]
Ready or not, here comes mama!

[to Tommy]
Do you like my nails?
Lets throw you two a pity party. Two fraidy ol' ladies. You gotta live live before it lives you, you stupid... You gonna be second class you gonna be second rate your whole life.
[from trailer]
Think of it as 'Easy Rider' in dresses.
[last lines]
Presenting the crown, Miss Julie Newmar.
Please, it's a wreck, ladies. Be careful with the... It'll never get you to California!
It's the look!
Now, Noxee, how could you possibly refuse?
Vaya con dios, Miss Chi-Chi.
You ruin my language and I still love you.
These all grow wild around here.

You all grow wild around here. This reminds me of the story of Princess Laritza in 'Revenge of the Wench'. Seem everyone was giving her flowers because they thought she was dead, right? But she had taken this magical concoction...
Well, anyway, bye-bye.
Bye.
Bye.
Enchanté.

[to Vida]
You're so tall.
I know there are drag queens in this town!
Maybe if somebody gave me back my "Princess" points, I would do the hitchhiking thing and get us a ride.
Now she going to herself kidnapped by some wild mountain man and we will have to rescue her.
Maybe if somebody gave me back my "Princess Points", I would do the hitchhiking thing and get us a ride.
How you gonna hitchhike, huh?, if there are no cars, stupid?
Well, you don't know me very well, do you, Creepella. I'm the Latina Marilyn Monroe. I got more legs than a bucket of chicken.
Now, she's going to get herself kidnapped by some wild mountain main and WE will have to rescue her.
Why she always gotta have the last word, huh?
Hi! I'm Noxeema Jackson. Jesse's daughter.
Ooh, Miss Clara, we gonna make you look like Emma Peel!
I think I'm gonna black out.
[she faints]

[while Vida, Noxie, and Chi-Chi are putting make-up on her]
I know, I know, that is Ms. Anne Baxter in the Ten Commandments and those are the moves.

[to the roughnecks]
If I was your bread, would you be my butter?

[to Noxeema]
And who would think that this ebony enchantress would one day share a title with moi?
Don't cry, Miss Chi-Chi, please don't cry... Miss Chi-Chi, if you were my girl, you'd never cry for anything, except... maybe... for happiness.
You said a mouthful
Noxeema, you remember John Jacob Jingleheimer Schmidt?

[shakes hand]
Oh yes, his name is my name too.
Do people always shout? I hate that.
If you want them to know there is steak for dinner, you got to let them *hear* it sizzle! Understand?
Yeah.

[to Vida]
Uh uh I'm not sleeping with the Wicked Witch of the West's toenails in my face and your Godzilla breath on me, no way!

[to Vida and Noxeema]
Mamies! Don't quote me but I think this one is decease-ed.
Well ladies, welcome to Snydersville.
Thank you.
Thanks.
I gotta go. I got cramps.
How're you gonna hitchhike, huh?, if there are no cars, stupid?
Well, you don't know me very well, do you, Creepella? I'm the Latina Marilyn Monroe. I got more legs than a bucket of chicken.
Why she always have to have the last word, huh?
Sheriff Dullard...
It's Dollard... with an "o."
Well, it says "Dullard" on your badge.
It's a misprint!
Excuse me Jimmy Jay.
Joe.
Sorry, Joe Jay.
No, Jimmy Joe.

[to Carol Ann]
Actin' real proud of yourself just like a New York City girl.
This is the presidential suite.
Must've been one of those bad presidents.
